titleproper.value: Guide to the Harold Cammer Papers <num>TAM.180</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-11-25T17:15:20</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 9 manuscript boxes and one half manuscript box

abstract.value: Harold I. Cammer (1909-1995) was a lawyer who championed the rights of workers, labor unions, accused Communists and victims of racial bigotry. This collection contains correspondence, articles and essays, briefs, and other documents pertaining to legal cases he was involved in, as well as his activism and other issues important to him during his lifetime.

p.value: Repository permission is required for access.
Identification of item, date; Harold Cammer Papers; TAM 180; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in repository, provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with these materials is 1950.161.
Source: "Harold Cammer, 86, Champion of Labor And Rights Lawyer," Lawrence van Gelder. <emph render="italic">New York</emph> edition. October 25, 1995

The collection includes case files, subject files, correspondence, and articles  produced by Cammer during the course of his legal career. Of particular note are his files from the Lawyers Committee on American Policy Towards Vietnam, legal briefs from his work on deportation cases and workers rights, and his involvement in efforts to advance desegregation and civil rights in Mississippi in the early 1960s.

subject.value: Labor unions and communism -- New York (State) -- New York.
Labor laws and legislation -- United States.
Labor unions and communism -- United States.

corpname.value: Lawyers Committee on American Policy Towards Vietnam
